body:
@Zhairgling Any reason you are trying to build libchromiumcontent as part of electron build?

If you still want to compile libchromiumcontent you need to go here: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/linux_build_instructions.md and install all the pre-requisites.

@Zhairgling You can do this:

> Once you have checked out the code, and assuming you're using Ubuntu, `run build/install-build-deps.sh

Just run this script: `https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/build/install-build-deps.sh`

From experience, just so you are prepared, depending on your computer compiling libcc will take up to 5 hours. Also the dependency script will have to install hundreds of packages.

@cifratila 
It seems rather that it is a problem with python (btw I don't know what) because when I use the command:
```
./script/bootstrap.py -v 
```

I have a similar problem : 
```
ju@ubuntu:~/buildElectron/electron$ ./script/bootstrap.py -v 
Running in verbose mode
git submodule sync --recursive
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/boto'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/breakpad'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/breakpad/src'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/crashpad'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/depot_tools'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/gyp'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/libchromiumcontent'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/libchromiumcontent/vendor/boto'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/libchromiumcontent/vendor/depot_tools'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/libchromiumcontent/vendor/python-patch'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/native_mate'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/node'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/pdf_viewer'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/pdf_viewer/vendor/grit'
Synchronizing submodule url for 'vendor/requests'
git submodule update --init --recursive
/home/ju/buildElectron/electron/script/update-clang.sh
Clang already at 284979-1
/usr/bin/python setup.py build
/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'extras_require'
  warnings.warn(msg)
/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'zip_safe'
  warnings.warn(msg)
/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'include_package_data'
  warnings.warn(msg)
/usr/lib/python2.7/distutils/dist.py:267: UserWarning: Unknown distribution option: 'install_requires'
  warnings.warn(msg)
running build
running build_py
/usr/bin/python setup.py build
running build
running build_py
running build_scripts
npm install --verbose
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 287, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 56, in main
    update_node_modules('.')
  File "./script/bootstrap.py", line 189, in update_node_modules
    execute_stdout(args, env)
  File "/home/ju/buildElectron/electron/script/lib/util.py", line 177, in execute_stdout
    subprocess.check_call(argv, env=env)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 536, in check_call
    retcode = call(*popenargs, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 523, in call
    return Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs).wait()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 711, in __init__
    errread, errwrite)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 1343, in _execute_child
    raise child_exception
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory
```

@Zhairgling Don't think the problem is python. You might need to check what the bootstrap script does.
I would recommend to run the clean script and then give the bootstrap script one more try.

Seems it fails on updating node modules, basically on running the following method: https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/script/bootstrap.py#L170

Try to run `npm install --verbose`

Also the script sets up the clang environment variables in order to compile native node modules.
